thread.title: Wing part confirmed to be from missing MH370
thread.title_full: Wing part confirmed to be from missing MH370

title: Wing part confirmed to be from missing MH370
text:
Wing part confirmed to be from missing MH370 6 August 2015 Save 
The wing part found washed up on a beach on Reunion island has been confirmed as coming from the missing MH370. 
Malaysian authorities have confirmed the flaperon found washed up last month was from the flight which disappeared en route from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing in May last year. 
While work is still being undertaken on the found piece, an initial report released suggests how the aircraft might have met its fate. 
The Independent Group, a collection of 15 scientists, engineers and aviators from around the world, said the fact that there is minimal damage to the flaperonâ€™s leading edge suggests that it was ripped off the wing before the crash. 
This would suggest that the pilots were not in control of the aircraft at the time of the crash and, if proved, would discredit other theories that it was a pilot suicide or deliberate, controlled crash onto the water. 
It would also back the original theory that something left the pilots incapacitated, leading the aircraft to fly on by itself and only coming down six hours later after it had run out of fuel.
